title: Definition of a Turning Point
text: A turning point is a point of the graph where the graph changes from increasing to decreasing (rising to falling) or decreasing to increasing (falling to rising).
speech: A turning point is a point of the graph where the graph changes from increasing to decreasing (rising to falling) or decreasing to increasing (falling to rising).
pacedSpeech: A turning point is a point of the graph where the graph changes from increasing to decreasing (rising to falling) or decreasing to increasing (falling to rising).

title: Expanding the Polynomial
text: Expand the polynomial to identify the degree of its leading term.
speech: Expand the polynomial to identify the degree of its leading term.
pacedSpeech: Expand the polynomial to identify the degree of its leading term.

title: Turning Points of a Polynomial of Degree $$n$$
text: A polynomial of degree $$n$$ has at most $$n-1$$ turning points.
speech: A polynomial of degree , n  has at most  n, minus 1,  turning points.
